item.title: Naughty Dog Working on New Unannounced Game
item.description:
Summary

  • Neil Druckmann is working on a new Naughty Dog IP while also managing Intergalactic and the TLoU adaptation.
  • Druckmann is shifting from his one-game focus to juggle multiple projects, one possibly being an Uncharted spin-off.
  • Speculation suggests Naughty Dog may unveil the mystery IP soon, hinting at a possible upcoming major gaming event.

Neil Druckmann has announced that he's working on an unannounced Naughty Dog IP while also actively involved in Intergalactic: The Heretic Prophet . Having recently directed a new episode of HBO's The Last of Us , Druckmann clearly has a packed schedule. He's been a key figure in Naughty Dog's Intergalactic: The Heretic Prophet , continues to collaborate closely with HBO on the live-action TLoU adaptation, and now, he's revealed there's even more in the pipeline.

Previously, Druckmann said he prefers to focus on one game at a time before considering the next. This comment came back in February when he was asked about the possibility of The Last of Us Part 3 . He explained that game development is "all-consuming," so he directs his full attention to the project at hand rather than looking ahead. Now, however, it seems Druckmann is pushing his limits by juggling multiple projects at once, two of which are AAA titles at Naughty Dog.

Speaking with Press X to Continue podcast's host Steffan Powell, The Last of Us creator revealed that another unannounced IP is in development at Naughty Dog alongside Intergalactic: The Heretic Prophet . While Druckmann avoided revealing any specific details about the mystery title, he noted that his role is more of a producer, an "executive" in the room, rather than the primary director. His main focus still appears to be Intergalactic , though even on that project, he mentioned working with several directors.

Naughty Dog's Mysterious New IP Could Be an Uncharted Spin-Off

Earlier this year, movie and video game insider Daniel Richtman leaked more The Last of Us Part 3 information, along with rumors about a possible second new IP in development at Naughty Dog. He also claimed that the unannounced project is being directed by Shaun Escayg, best known for his work on Uncharted: The Lost Legacy . Combined with Druckmann's recent comments, this has fueled speculation that Naughty Dog's next game could be an Uncharted spin-off.

According to the same leaker who first mentioned Naughty Dog's unannounced game, the mysterious IP has been in development for over three years. For context, the studio revealed Intergalactic nearly four years into its development, choosing The Game Awards 2024 for the official announcement.

Based on that pattern, it's likely that Naughty Dog could unveil its latest IP at an upcoming major gaming event. Many also believe Neil Druckmann's recent openness about the project hints that the studio is gearing up to reveal it publicly. Still, fans should take these rumors with a grain of salt, as nothing has been officially confirmed.

item.title: Oblivion Remastered: 10 Best Quest Rewards That Are Worth The Effort
item.description:
Summary

  • Oblivion Remastered offers varied quests, with some providing significant rewards.
  • Certain quests offer valuable rewards like buffs, unique items, and residences.
  • Completing specific quests can grant permanent buffs, powerful weapons, and Daedric artifacts.

Oblivion Remastered offers hundreds of quests for players to take on, all ranging in a variety of rewards. Some quests can be a challenge at certain levels but offer measly quest rewards or items that could be purchased somewhere else. However, there are some quests that are worth the effort and can grant players fun abilities and tools.

The following rewards can shape certain builds, offer fun ways to complete other quests, or are just upgrades worth having in the game. Here's a rundown on how each of them works and the quests players need to complete in order to get them.

This list contains slight spoilers for certain quests in The Elder Scrolls 4: Oblivion Remastered .

10 Ring of Khajiiti

For Speed And Stealth

  • Quest: Meridia
  • Stats: 35% Chameleon and Fortify Speed 10 pts.

A Breton healer at Meridia’s Shrine named Basil Ernarde will offer a quest to players over level 10, suggesting they leave an offering at the shrine in the form of remains of the undead. Offering any ingredient from an undead creature will do, and Meridia will then instruct players to wipe out the necromancers in Howling Cave.

This quest involves heading east of Castle Skingrad to the Howling Cave, where a challenging fight against necromancers will ensue. After successfully culling the five necromancers and their army of summons, players can return to the Shrine. Here, Meridia will give players the Ring of Khajiiti, a ring that fortifies speed and gives players Chameleon , acting as a great accessory for any stealth builds.

9 Benirus Manor in Anvil

A Well-Earned Home In Anvil

  • Quest: Where the Spirits Have Lease
  • Stats: A Two-Floor House in Anvil.

This quest begins when players meet Velwyn Benirus, an Imperial man looking for potential buyers willing to take his late grandfather’s mansion, Benirus Manor. If players purchase the house for 5,000 Gold (one of the cheaper residences in all of Cyrodiil) and sleep in it, they will discover that the place is haunted. After tracking down Velwyn and convincing him to help lift the curse, he will take players down to a Sealed Portal in the basement.

This quest takes a dark turn and has a challenging but rewarding fight when players meet Lorgren Benirus, the original owner of the Manor who now lies half-dead as a corpse in a necromancer chamber. Once players destroy Logren Benirus once and for all, the curse will be lifted, and they will have access to the Manor for themselves.

8 Night Mother’s Blessing

A Permanent Buff To Stealth

  • Quest: Whodunit?
  • Stats: Permanent +2 Bonus to Acrobatics, Blade, Marksman, Security, and Sneak.

The Night Mother’s Blessing is a permanent buff that players can get after completing the Dark Brotherhood quest, “Whodunit?” Once players receive their assignment from Ocheeva, they must travel to Skingrad and enter Summitmist Manor, where they must play the part of killer in a murder mystery.

All of the Dark Brotherhood quests are worth doing for both reward and engaging stories, and this quest appears somewhat close to the end. Once players successfully fulfill their role for the Dark Brotherhood here, they can gain the Night Mother’s Blessing, a powerful buff that permanently increases a couple of points in Acrobatics, Blade, Marksman, Security, and Sneak.

7 Gray Cowl of Nocturnal

Become the Legendary Gray Fox

  • Quest: The Ultimate Heist
  • Stats: Become the Gray Fox. Detect Lift up to 120 ft. Fortify Sneak 25 pts. Feather 200 pts.

Getting access to the Gray Cowl of Nocturnal is no easy feat, as it requires completing the entirety of the Thieves Guild questline. After completing 11 of the main Thieves Guild quests, players will finally get the “The Ultimate Heist” quest, where they must steal a highly valuable item and find out the truth about the Gray Fox.

The Gray Cowl of Nocturnal is essential for any thief-centered build. Wearing it makes NPCs unable to discern the player from themselves or the Gray Fox. On top of that, all infamy and bounties gained while wearing the Cowl go away when taking it off, making it a perfect disguise for those looking to get away with any crime.

6 Summon Golden Saint / Dark Seducer

Summoning Elite Daedra Allies

  • Quest: The Helpless Army
  • Stats: Summon Golden Saint or Summon Dark Seducer.

Before players can gain access to these powerful summons, they must first cross the threshold of Madness through a strange door in Niben Bay and into the Shivering Isles. During the process of completing 9 of the main quests for Shivering Isles, players will have met the Daedric Prince of Madness, Sheogorath, and become the Duke/Duchess of either Mania or Dementia.

In “The Helpless Army” quest, players will assist the Dark Seducers if they are the Duke/Duchess of Mania, and the Golden Saints if they are Duke/Duchess of Dementia. These summons are usable only once a day, but they are worth it due to how extremely powerful they are. They are immune to silence, with the Golden Saint being able to reflect spells with a lesser power that disintegrates weapons upon touch and the Dark Seducer being able to absorb spells and absorb health on touch.

5 Mehrunes' Razor

The Extremely Sharp Dagger

  • Quest: Unearthing Mehrunes’ Razor
  • Stats: Disintegrate Armor 15 pts for 7 seconds. Daedric Banishing on Strike.

Mehrunes' Razor is perfect for those who love chance, as the Daedric Banishing enchantment on it has a chance of instantly killing a target based on the player's Luck value. “Unearthing Mehrunes' Razor” is a singular quest featuring a large challenging dungeon, but the dagger and other things found throughout are worth it.

This quest can be started by overhearing rumors speaking of signs of life being spotted at Sundercliff Watch. Upon entering the ruined fort, players will be attacked by Drothmeri Soldiers and will eventually find the Sundercliff Village hidden away in the caves. The Morag Tong Armor set can be found here, but it’s well worth the effort to follow the quest all the way to the end to get Mehrunes' Razor.

4 Spell Breaker

Best Shield Against All Magic

  • Quest: Peryite
  • Stats: Reflect Spell 30%.

When players initially find Peryite’s Shrine, they will find Peryite’s worshippers frozen still, standing in a sleep-like state and unresponsive to any interaction. Being at least level 10, players can speak with the Daedric Prince, who will inform them that after the follower’s failed attempt to summon him, their souls were sent to Oblivion and trapped there.

There are a total of five souls to rescue from the Realm of Peryite. Once players save the worshippers and return to the Shrine of Peryite, they will be rewarded with one of the best shields in the game, the Spell Breaker , a heavy armor Daedric Artifact with a constant 30% spell reflection enchantment.

3 Goldbrand

Setting Tamriel Ablaze

  • Quest: Boethia
  • Stats: 25 Base Damage. 22 pts Fire Damage per hit.

This quest is available to players who reach at least level 20, and it is started when they travel southeast of Cheydinhal, high in the Valus Mountains, and talk to Haekwon at Boethia’s Shrine. Players should have a Daedra Heart ready to offer to Boethia, who accepts the offering but doesn’t recognize them as a worthy “Chosen.” Beothia opens a portal nearby and tells the player to fight in the Tournament of the Ten Bloods, facing off against Beothia’s Chosen one at a time in the realm of Oblivion.

Waiting for this quest to appear and the challenge of completing it is well worth the effort; when players return to the Shrine after winning the tournament, Beothia will grant them a golden katana known as Goldbrand . Since this quest has a fairly high level cap, this weapon only comes around mid-game but is possibly the most powerful one-handed weapon in Oblivion Remastered .

2 Azura’s Star

The Reusable Soul Gem

  • Quest: Azura
  • Stats: Zero weight reusable Grand Soul Gem.

Once players reach at least level 2, they can find the Shrine of Azura and speak to a night elf worshipper standing nearby. He suggests players leave an offering of Glow Dust to Azura’s Shrine at dawn or dusk. Once players place an offering, Azura will task them with killing former worshippers of Azura who have been turned into vampires and trapped in the Gutted Mine.

This quest is fairly short and sweet, but it offers a ridiculously powerful Daedric Artifact. Azura’s Star is essentially a reusable grand soul gem. It still requires the capturing of souls, but since it never leaves the inventory, it has unlimited uses.

1 Shadowmere

The Trusty Immortal Steed

  • Quest: The Purification
  • Stats: Essential Mount

Getting Shadowmere requires players to join the Dark Brotherhood and make it very close to the end of the whole questline. This shadowy steed is awarded to players once they complete “The Purification” quest, which is a quest that drastically changes what it means to be in the Dark Brotherhood.

Once players succeed in their task of “Purification,” Lucien gives them Shadowmere. This horse is one of the fastest mounts in the game and the only “essential” horse, meaning that she cannot die. Shadowmere is not only helpful in completing the rest of the Dark Brotherhood, but she offers a permanent method of traveling quickly and safely around Cyrodiil without any extra magic.

6 Images
6 Images

item.title: Helldivers 2: How Does Sample Extricator Work (& Is It Worth Using?)
item.description:
The Borderline Justice Warbond in Helldivers 2 holds more than just cowboy-themed gear. It also has Sample Extricator, a unique booster meant to help players who are having trouble getting samples for Super Destroyer upgrades. What this booster does is simple, yet it begs the question: is it worth using over all other available options?

Collecting samples is mandatory if you want to progress your account, but the harder the difficulty in Helldivers 2 , the riskier sample collection becomes, and if you don't want to farm easy missions just to get samples, then you'll want to make use of every advantage you have. In this guide, we'll be looking at how Sample Extricator works to see if it's worth your time.

Helldivers 2: Is Sample Extricator Worth Using?

Sample Extricator's usefulness is situational . Its effect is fairly simple: when equipped by a member of the squad, all large enemies in the mission will have a small chance to drop a Common Sample . The exact drop rate is unclear, but up to 10 Common Samples can be obtained via this booster, and with it, players can exceed the maximum number of Common Samples in the mission.

From a practical standpoint, Sample Extricator could be worth using if players need a lot of Common Samples for Super Destroyer upgrades. If you're the type who doesn't enjoy scouring the entire map for samples, then this booster should help you get a few more just by fighting big enemies like Bile Titans and Factory Striders. However, on higher difficulties, Sample Extricator is next to useless for a few reasons.

First, given how many enemies tend to spawn on Difficulty 7 and above, gathering samples that fall from dead heavy units is often risky . Non-melee heavies (especially in Automaton missions) are likely to die in positions that are overrun by smaller enemies, or they are too far away for players to reach.

Second, players are expected to keep moving on higher difficulties . Staying in one location for too long is an easy way to get overwhelmed, and when you're expected to run away, you'll just end up missing out on the samples that do drop from enemies.

Third, other boosters are simply better . In the face of overwhelming odds, it's usually better to have passive boosters that provide more tangible benefits, such as extra stamina and health or Resupply pods armed with rifle turrets.

Lastly, even if players are capable of collecting samples, extracting them is an entirely different story . Exiting a D10 mission with samples is by no means impossible, but there will be times when players will be forced to abandon samples, so keep that in mind.

Despite all that, if you want to casually farm Common Samples in Difficulty 6 and below, Sample Extricator is a decent booster to have. It won't help you in a fight, but considering how the lower half of Helldivers 2's difficulty spectrum is much easier, none of the things listed above should pose a problem.

6 Images
6 Images

item.title: Blades Of Fire: How To Unlock More Weapon Scrolls
item.description:
Blades of Fire features some of the most brutally satisfying combat mechanics, boasting a system that falls somewhere between a Souls-lite and the latest God of War games. There is a lot of depth to dangerous enemies, requiring the protagonist, Aran de Lira, to use different stances and weapons in order to take them down.

Some enemies are easy to take down with a variety of different weapons, while some of the stronger monsters roaming the world need specific weapons in order to be taken out. This guide will show you how Aran gains access to more weapon types in Blades of Fire .

How To Get More Forge Scrolls In Blades Of Fire

Blades of Fire ​​​​​​has a big focus on crafting and forging weapons for Aran. Each weapon has its distinct style and feel. Whether you prefer wielding faster daggers or smashing heads with a Warhammer, there's a style that caters to all tastes. To create new weapons, Aran must forge them at an Anvil after defeating enemies to obtain Forge Scrolls.

However, you must ensure that Aran's young chronicler, Asdo, is present when fighting and defeating them so that he can record the kills in the Forge Scrolls menu. Aran must kill a specific number of enemies in order to unlock their weapon type in the Forge Scrolls. For example, you must defeat 60 Putrids to obtain the Claymore Greatsword or five spearmen to get the Long Spear.

There are five weapon types in Blades of Fire :

  • Daggers
  • Swords
  • Greatswords
  • Polearms
  • Spears

If you forget to recall Asdo to Aran's side, your battles won't be recorded in his chronicles, and kills won't count toward Forge Scrolls.

How To Call Asdo Into The Field In Blades Of Fire

If he's not present, you can call Asdo from camp to accompany Aran, chronicle his journey, and provide information about items found in the field. He can also open magically sealed doorways and reveal information about secrets and collectibles located on the map.

T o call or dismiss Asdo, you can press right on the d-pad or T on the keyboard . It is beneficial to speak with Asdo frequently for lore and information about the quest and other characters encountered. However, you should send him back to camp occasionally in order to chronicle the adventure and make drawings in the book, which can be invaluable when exploring and expanding the lore in said text.

3 Images

item.title: Oblivion Remastered: The Major Cities Of Cyrodiil
item.description:
Summary

  • Cyrodiil is home to various towns and villages with unique histories and settings.
  • The Imperial City serves as the central hub for vendors, resources, and quests in the game.
  • Each city in Cyrodiil has its own attractions, amenities, and secrets for players to discover.

Like most RPGs, the world of The Elder Scrolls includes several countries and regions that serve to entertain and terrify adventurers. Cyrodiil is one of these locations, and being the center of the empire, it serves as the setting for several of the standalone games in the series.

There are several other towns and villages scattered throughout Cyrodiil, and they look even better in The Elder Scrolls 4: Oblivion Remastered . Each city has its own unique history and setting, with some being nestled in snowy mountains and farmland and others being located next to rivers, lakes, or swamps.

9 The Imperial City

Capital And Seat of the Septim Royal Line

  • Location: Centrally located, surrounded by Lake Rumare and the Upper Niben River.

It's some royal intrigue regarding the Emperor himself that starts the game in this location. The player's early goal is to escape from the confines of the capital, but their path leads them back sooner rather than later because this is where everything is when it comes to vendors, merchants, resources, trainers, and quests.

Looking at a map of the entire region, it's true that all roads lead to the Imperial City. It also has dungeons, caves, and other secrets, and a player can spend a lot of time here leveling and exploring before heading into the wilderness.

8 Kvatch

Saved From Oblivion, Sort Of

  • Location: Follow the roads that lead southwest from Skingrad or northeast from Anvil.

Unfortunately, Kvatch is in ruins for the duration of Oblivion, but players who are keen on seeing an intact and functioning city can visit the same region in The Elder Scrolls Online . In the meantime, there are a few survivors who have put together a modest camp at the bottom of the hill outside the city, and this is where the hero can take advantage of repair and vending services.

The player can wait to close this Oblivion gate if they want, but closing it is connected to the main quest. After completing "Breaking the Siege of Kvatch" and "The Battle for Castle Kvatch," the main character can take Martin Septim to Weynon Priory and eventually to Cloud Ruler Temple.

7 Skingrad

Has Everything A New Hero Needs

  • Location: Southwest of the Imperial city, east of Kvatch.

Given the size and location, adventurers will be making plenty of stops in Skingrad, not only for the amenities but also for networking with various guilds and NPCs. Rumors say that Count Janus Hassildor Skingrad is a powerful wizard and secretly also a vampire, which is one of many secrets an adventurer can discover locally.

There's a Fighters Guild and a Mages Guild for tired adventurers looking for training, along with various places for repairs and resources. Even if the player has to pay for a bed, there are taverns and inns here for every level of service, from rustic to luxurious, and virtually every location has a few interesting and talkative NPCs.

6 Anvil

A Seaside Pirate Sanctuary

  • Location: The last city on the road leading west from Kvatch, on the shores of the Abacean Sea.

There's a lot of Hammerfell and Valenwood's influence here in Anvil, with both places being closer than the Imperial City when considering both trade and travel time. This is a small city with prosperous trading connections, and players will notice that there seems to be a lot of money here, considering the population and size.

For those who have downloaded the Knights of the Nine DLC or are playing the remastered version, the questline starts in Anvil. Other quests here include finding the missing husband of Countess Millona Umbranox and exploring a haunted manor.

5 Chorrol

East Of Battlehorn Castle

  • Location: Follow the Black Road west through the Great Forest.

Chorrol is placed in a more isolated area in the western part of the Great Forest on the Black Road, which leads to the Imperial City. Players can follow the road west to where it ends in the Colovian Highlands to find Battlehorn Castle, an option for housing added with the Fighter's Stronghold DLC.

Most players will find Chorrol as they follow part of the main quest to Weynon Priory, which is located just south of the city gates. The Fighters Guild here can offer members plenty to do, plus there's the matter of missing children, stolen paintings, and that unsightly Oblivion gate directly south of town.

4 Bruma

Access To The Jerrel Mountains

  • Location: Due north of the Imperial City, north of the junction between the Orange Road and the Silver Road.

Bruma has fewer lofty towers or elaborate decor, and design here is more about function than form, which means people care less about how things look provided they're keeping out the cold. This is the northernmost point of Cyrodiil, with only the lofty Jerrel Mounatians separating Bruma from neighboring Skyrim.

There are a few famous landmarks nearby, such as Dragon Claw Rock to the north and Gnoll Mountain to the east, the latter of which is home to a player housing option in Frostcrag Spire. Most players will discover Bruma when they take Martin Septim to Cloud Ruler Temple, which is directly north of Bruma, as part of the main questline.

3 Cheydinhal

The City At The End Of The Blue Road

  • Location: Follow the Blue Road east of the Imperial City, located south of the shores of Lake Arrius.

Quaintly Bavarian with its Fachwerk houses and Gothic church, Cheydinhal is one of the most beautiful cities in Cyrodiil, partly thanks to the influence of neighboring Morrowind. It's nestled in a verdant forest, complete with snowy mountains in the background and a nearby lake.

Players can just come for the view, but there's also plenty to keep a hero busy. The Mages Guild, Fighters Guild, and the Dark Brotherhood all have a strong presence here, and for those who have the Knights of the Nine DLC, the Great Chapel of Arkay is part of the questline.

2 Bravil

A Quiet Seaside Town

  • Location: On the confluence of the Larsius River and Niben Bay.

There's a lot for an adventurer to do in Bravil, which is one of the grittier and less forgiving towns in Cyrodiil. Located on Nibenay Bay, the city is close to the border of Elswyr and bordered on the south by the Larsius River, and its poverty is reflected in the simple home designs, large number of vagrants, and unkempt houses.

Players with the Shivering Isles DLC can find the door to Sheogorath's wacky realm on an island off the coast, and only a city as dark and cynical as Bravil would house the Crypt of the Night Mother. Thieves who are in touch with their local guild have more to do here in relation to other cities, and those who are still looking for a Gray Fox contact can find one here.

1 Leyawiin

A Small Town With Many Secrets

  • Location: The southernmost city in Cyrodiil, at the mouth of the Lower River Niben.

There might not be much to Leyawiin at first, but there's a lot to explore in this isolated corner of Cyrodiil. It's a plain stone architecture squeezed between Elswyer and the Black Marsh, which is why many of the residents are Khajit and Argonians.

Most of the quests here involve bandits, skooma dealers, and forest vermin, but players who want to do some exploring can find Ayelid ruins, forts, camps, mines, and several Nirnroot along the southern coast and the banks of the Lower Niben.

6 Images
6 Images
